info.title: OPERA Cloud Room Rotation Configuration Service API
info.description:
APIs to cater for Room Rotation Configuration functionality in OPERA Cloud. Api provides capability to handle Room Rotation in OPERA Cloud. Room Rotation provides room ownership options for automatic inventory rotation and prioritization for owner rooms assignment and occupancy.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 24.4.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2024 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.description:
Use this API to get configured Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

OperationId:getAdjustmentReasons

parameters.name: fetchInactive
parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Rotation Adjustment Reason Codes to be searched.  Multiple values can be entered by adding multiple query parameters.

parameters.name: wildCard
parameters.description: Wildcard search on the code.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the code.

200.description: Response object for fetching Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

post.description:
Use this API to post Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

OperationId:postAdjustmentReasons

parameters.name: CreateAdjustmentReasonsDetails
parameters.description: Request object for creating a new Room Rotation Adjustment Reason.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Use this API to update Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

OperationId:putAdjustmentReasons

parameters.name: adjustmentReasonsId
parameters.description: Unique ID of Room Rotation Adjustment Reason

parameters.name: ChangeAdjustmentReasonsDetails
parameters.description: Request object for changing an existing Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

200.description: Response Body.

delete.description:
Use this API to delete Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

OperationId:deleteAdjustmentReasons

parameters.name: adjustmentReasonsId
parameters.description: Unique ID of Room Rotation Adjustment Reason.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Code of the Room Rotation Adjustment Reason.  Multiple values can be entered by adding multiple query parameters.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.summary: Retrieve all Room Rotation Revenue Transaction Codes
get.description:
Use this API to retrieve all existing Room Rotation Revenue Transaction Codes for a given hotel.

OperationId:getRevenueTransactionCodes

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: rotationRevenue
parameters.description: Indicate to retrieve transaction codes that are marked as Rotation Revenue transaction codes. If this value is omitted, all transaction codes will be returned for the given property.

200.description: Response object for retrieving revenue transaction codes for a given property

put.summary: Update the room rotation revenue status of a set of transaction codes
put.description:
Use this API to update the room rotation revenue status of a set of transaction codes.

OperationId:putRevenueTransactionCodes

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: ChangeRevenueTransactionCodesCriteria
parameters.description: Request object for updating the rotation revenue status of a transaction code for a given property.

200.description: Response Body.

get.description:
Use this API to fetch Room Rotation Period based on criteria.

OperationId:getRotationPeriod

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

200.description: Response Object for Fetch Rotation Period

put.description:
Use this API to change Room Rotation Period.

OperationId:putRotationPeriod

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: rotationPeriod
parameters.description: Request Object for changing Rotation Period

200.description: Response Body.

post.summary: Save changes to Rotation Setup Rules and recalculate Rotation Points
post.description:
This operation will create/update/delete Rotation Setup Rules sent in the request and then recalculate rotation points.

OperationId:postRoomRotationRules

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: rotationRules
parameters.description: Request object for saving changes to room rotation setup rules.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.summary: Retrieve all Room Rotation Setup Rules
get.description:
Use this API to retrieve all existing Room Rotation Setup Rules based on criteria.

OperationId:getRotationRules

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: setupType
parameters.description: Simple type for Rotation Setup Rule(s).

parameters.name: inactiveRules
parameters.description: If set to True, only Inactive Rotation Setup Rules will be retrieved. Otherwise, only Active Rotation Setup Rules will be retrieved.

200.description: Response object for retrieving rotation rules for a given property

post.description:
This API has been deprecated and will be replaced by

OperationId:postRoomRotationRules

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: rotationRules
parameters.description: Request object for creating Rotation Rules for a given property

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

delete.summary: Delete an existing Room Rotation Rule
delete.description:
This API has been deprecated and will be replaced by

OperationId:postRoomRotationRules

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: Unique ID of Rotation Rule.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
This API has been deprecated and will be replaced by

OperationId:postRoomRotationRules

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: Unique Rotation Group Code.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: rotationRules
parameters.description: Request object for changing room rotation rules.

200.description: Response Body.

get.summary: Get Room Rotation Owner Room Grades
get.description:
Use this API to Get Room Rotation Owner Room Grades.

OperationId:getUnitGrades

parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: hotelIds
parameters.description: Unique ID(s) of hotel(s).

parameters.name: fetchInactive
parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Configured Owner Room Grade Codes to be searched.  Multiple values can be entered by adding multiple query parameters.

parameters.name: wildCard
parameters.description: Wildcard search on Owner Room Grade Codes.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of Owner Room Grade Codes.

200.description: Response object for fetching Room Rotation Unit Grades.

post.summary: Create a new Room Rotation Owner Room Grade Code

Use this API to create a new Room Rotation Owner Room Grade Code.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: CreateUnitGradesDetails
parameters.description: Request object for creating a new Room Rotation Owner Room Unit Grade.

get.description:
Use this API to fetch profile Owner Referral Records.

OperationId:getRoomOwnerReferrals

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Unique ID of profile.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: If set to True, Inactive Room Owner Referrals will also be retrieved. Otherwise, only Active Room Owner Referrals details will be retrieved.

200.description: Response for getRoomOwnerReferrals operation.

Use this API to create multiple Room Owner Referral Records.

Use this API to update Room Owner Referral Record.

get.description:
Use this API to fetch profile Room Ownership Records.

OperationId:getProfileRoomOwners

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Unique ID of profile.

parameters.name: showInactiveRoomOwners
parameters.description: If set to True, Inactive Room Ownership Records will also be retrieved. Otherwise, only Active Room Ownership Records will be retrieved.

200.description: Response for getProfileRoomOwner operation.

Use this API to create Create Room Ownership Record.

OperationId:postRoomOwner

parameters.name: createRoomOwnerDetails
parameters.description: Request object for creating room ownership record..

201.description: Response object to hold room ownership conflict records.

Use this API to update Multiple Room Ownership Records across properties.

parameters.description: Request object for changing room ownership record.

200.description: Response object to hold room ownership conflict records.

Use this API to delete Room Ownership Record.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

FetchAdjustmentReasonsDetails.description: Response object for creating Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

adjustmentReasons.description: Collection of Room Rotation Adjustment Reasons.

roomRotationAdjustmentReasonsType.description: Room Rotation Adjustment Reason Enumeration element.

code.description: Defines the Rotation Adjustment Reason Code.

description.description: Description of the Rotation Adjustment Reason.

translationTextType2000.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 1 to 2000.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

FetchRevenueTransactionCodesDetails.description: Response object for retrieving revenue transaction codes for a given property

revenueTransactionCodes.description: Revenue transaction codes for a given property value.

hotelId.description: Hotel code of revenue transaction code.

transactionCode.description: Unique ID for the Transaction Code.

rotationRevenue.description: Indicates that the transaction code is marked as a rotation revenue transaction code.

revenueTransactionCodes.description: Revenue transaction codes for a given property value.

rotationRevenueTransactionCodesChangeTyp.description: Two collections of transaction codes for a resort. One collection lists codes to be changed to Rotation Revenue transaction codes and the other to be changed to non Rotation Revenue Transaction codes.

hotelId.description: Hotel code of revenue transaction code.

rotationRevenueTransactionCodes.description: List of transaction codes to be updated to rotation revenue transaction codes.

nonRotationRevenueTransactionCodes.description: List of transaction codes to be updated to non rotation revenue transaction codes.

success.description: Refer to Generic common types document.

warnings.description: Refer to Generic common types document.

errors.description: Refer to Generic common types document.

echoToken.description: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

timeStamp.description: Indicates the creation date and time of the message in UTC using the following format specified by ISO 8601; YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock (e.g. 20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z).

version.description: For all Opera versioned messages, the version of the message is indicated by a Opera Version value.

correlationId.description: Allow end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

retryAllowed.description: Indicates if the operation supports the ability to retry the request.

enforceAllowed.description: Indicates if the operation supports the ability to force the retry request through OPERA services in the case where the external system continues to fail.

useLocalAllowed.description: This attribute carries the user selected confirmation value on confirmation popup.

successType.description: Returning an empty element of this type indicates the successful processing of an message. This is used in conjunction with the Warning Type to report any warnings or business errors.

errorsType.description: An error that occurred during the processing of a message.

errorType.description: Standard way to indicate that an error occurred during the processing of an message. If the message successfully processes, but there are business errors, those errors should be passed in the warning element.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

correlationId.description: Allow end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

retryAllowed.description: Indicates if the operation supports the ability to retry the request.

enforceAllowed.description: Indicates if the operation supports the ability to force the retry request through OPERA services in the case where the external system continues to fail.

rotationRulesResultType.description: Collection of Room Rotation Setup Rules Results.

rotationRules.description: Information representing Room Rotation Setup Rules.

masterInfo.description: Collection of RateCodes, RoomTypes, Out of Order Reasons

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

rotationRulesType.description: Collection of Room Rotation Setup Rules elements.

hotelId.description: Hotel code for Room Rotation Setup Rules.

setupType.description: Represents Setup type for Room Rotation Setup Rule.

rule.description: Description of the Room Rotation Setup Rule.

rotationRuleSetupType.description: Simple type for Rotation Rule Setup.

status.description: Represents Record Status of Room Rotation Setup Rule.

setupType.description: Represents Setup type for Room Rotation Setup Rule.

ruleId.description: Unique ID for Room Rotation Setup Rule.

startDate.description: Represents start date for Room Rotation Setup Rule.

endDate.description: Represents end date for Room Rotation Setup Rule.

daysOfWeek.description: Represents the days for which the Room Rotation Setup Rule are applicable.

calculationRule.description: Represents the calculation type applicable for Rotation Point Rules.

referral.description: Indicates that this Rotation Setup Rule is to be used for Owner Referral Reservations.

points.description: Represents total points for a Rotation Setup Rule. (To be used with Rotation Point Rules)

multiplier.description: Represents multiplier value to be used for an Owner Multiplier Rule or an Out of Order / Service Multiplier rule.

reasons.description: Represents Out Of Order/Service reasons in which an Owner Multiplier Rule is appplicable for.

rateCodes.description: Represents Rate Codes in which the Rotation Setup Rule is applicable for (Either for Rotation Point Rules, or Owner Multiplier Rules).

roomTypes.description: Represents Room Types in which the Room Rotation Setup Rule is applicable for (At least 1 Room Type is required).

rotationRuleCalculationRuleType.description: Simple type for Rotation Setup Rule Calculation Rule.

FetchRotationRules.description: Response object for retrieving rotation setup rules for a given property

rotationRulesResult.description: Retrieve Rotation Setup Rules for a given property.

fetchRotationPeriod.description: Response Object for Fetch Rotation Period

hotelId.description: Property code for Room Rotation Period.

startDate.description: Represents Effective start date for the Room Rotation Period Setup.

periodFrequency.description: Represents Effective Period reset frequency for the Room Rotation Period Setup.

currentPeriodStartDate.description: The start date for the property's current Rotation Period.

roomRotationRules.description: Request object for saving changes to room type rotation rules.

forceRecalculate.description: Indicates if Rotation points recalculation job should be re-triggered.

rotationRules.description: Defines collection of Room Rotation Setup Rules.

roomOwnerReferralDetails.description: Response object containing Room Owner Referral details.

hasOwnershipRecords.description: Flag to indicate if the associated profile has any active Room Ownership records attached to it.

roomOwnerReferrals.description: Collection of Detailed information on Room Owner's Referral records.

roomOwnerReferralType.description: Define the search criteria for retrieving Room Owner Referral records

hotelId.description: Hotel Code of Room Owner Referral record.

roomOwnerId.description: Unique Id for Room Ownership record.

roomOwnerReferralId.description: Unique Id for Room Owner Referral record.

referral.description: Type of referral to the room owner/target profile.

startDate.description: Start Date of the Room Owner Referral record.

endDate.description: End Date of the Room Owner Referral record.

roomId.description: Room Id of Room Owner Referral record.

profileName.description: Profile Name of the Room Owner Referral record.

profileAddress.description: Address details for the profile on the Room Owner Referral record

profileId.description: Profile ID of the Room Owner Referral record.

inactive.description: Status of the Room Owner Referral record.

inactiveDate.description: Date in which the room owner referral record was marked as inactive.

createRoomOwnerReferralDetails.description: Request object for creating Room Owner Referral records.

roomOwnerReferrals.description: Details to create Room Owner Referral records.

changeRoomOwnerReferralDetails.description: Request object for changing Room Owner Referral records.

roomOwnerReferral.description: Criteria to change the Room Owner Referral record.

isValidated.description: Indicator to define if the Address is validated by the Address Validation System.

addressLine.description: When the address is unformatted (FormattedInd="false") these lines will contain free form address details. When the address is formatted and street number and street name must be sent independently, the street number will be sent using StreetNmbr, and the street name will be sent in the first AddressLine occurrence.

cityName.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

cityExtension.description: Post Office City Extension Code number. City Extension mainly used for UK addresses.

county.description: County or District Name (e.g., Fairfax). This is read only.

type.description: Defines the type of address (e.g. home, business, other).

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

barCode.description: The postal barcode for the address.

creatorId.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierId.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

countryNameType.description: Code for a country or a nationality.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 200.

code.description: Code for a country or a nationality.

referralType.description: Indicates the type of referral for a Profile to the Room Owner.

managedByOptions.description: Describes of the Configuration is Managed by Enterprise or Property.

tags.name: RoomRotationConfig
tags.description: The REST APIs allow you to perform all actions related to Room Rotation from configuring point calculations for owner rooms, adjustment options for room prioritization and automatic assignment based on owner room utilization.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Oracle Hospitality
